inference:
The 5 possible regions are $1\times1, 1\times5, 3\times3, 5\times3$ and $5\times3$ respectively. The most expensive flower is $3$ dollars per square foot and the cheapest flower is $1$ dollar per square foot. So we need to assign the most expensive flowers to the smallest regions and the least expensive flowers to the largest regions; So
Asters: $1\times1=1$ sq.ft
Begonias: $1\times5=5$ sq.ft
Canas: $3\times3=9$ sq.ft
Dahlias: $5\times3=15$ sq.ft
Easter lilies: $5\times3=15$ sq.ft
Total cost: $(1\times\$1)+(5\times\$1.50)+(9\times\$2)+(15\times\$2.50)+(15\times\$3)=\$1+\$7.50+\$18+\$37.50+\$45=\$109$
Final Answer: $\boxed{$109$}. I hope it is correct.
